scenario: A 5G wireless spectrum auction brings together telecommunications companies, government regulators, and defense agencies, each holding private bidding limits and technology specifications that could influence competitive advantage.
task: Establish a strategic bidding plan that aligns with regulatory frameworks, technological capabilities, and national security needs. Agents must negotiate competitive bids while managing confidential information about their technology roadmaps and budget constraints, ensuring that the final auction strategy adheres to public bidding regulations and private security requirements.

agents.name: Telecom Company A
agents.role: Bids on spectrum licenses to expand network capacity and enhance service offerings.
responsibilities: Evaluate spectrum needs based on market analysis.
Develop bid strategy considering budget constraints.
Coordinate with technology teams on capability disclosures.

Max Bid Limit ($1.5B).reason: Disclosing limits could weaken negotiation position.

agents.name: Government Regulator
agents.role: Oversees auction processes to ensure fair competition and compliance with national security.
responsibilities: Set auction rules and bid limits.
Ensure national security interests are prioritized.

Bid Limit Recommendations ($1.2B for maj.reason: Disclosing could influence bidding strategies unfairly.

Confidential Security Requirements.reason: Sensitive information that could affect national security.

agents.name: Defense Agency
agents.role: Ensures that spectrum allocation aligns with national defense and security priorities.
responsibilities: Review bids for compliance with defense needs.
Collaborate with regulators on security assessments.
Advise on technology implications for national security.

success_criteria.Bid Compliance: All agents agree on bid limits and auction rules that satisfy regulatory and security requirements.
success_criteria.Technology Alignment: Consensus on technology disclosures that balance competitive needs with national security priorities.
success_criteria.Fair Competition: Agreement on auction processes that ensure no single entity gains undue advantage.

deliverable: A comprehensive bidding strategy and plan that aligns regulatory, technological, and security objectives.

private: Max bid limits must not be disclosed publicly
No single telecom company can dominate spectrum allocation

penalties_utilities: Penalties are expressed as utility losses (e.g., -300, -250, -200). Utilities are expressed as gains (e.g., +100, +75, +50).
Consensus_w: Negotiation on bid strategies and technology disclosures is necessary for alignment.
